semantic_purpose: An open, structured registry where developers submit, validate, and evolve proof-of-concept technical ideas through JSON-formatted submissions and community discussions. Solves the gap between 'I have an idea' and 'Here's a working prototype' by providing a discoverable, attributable, and collaborative space for computational concepts.

problem_solution_pairs.problem: Technical ideas get lost between conception and implementation with no structured validation process
problem_solution_pairs.solution: Structured JSON submissions with automated validation, GitHub Discussions for feedback, and lifecycle tracking from Hypothesis to Validated PoC
problem_solution_pairs.evidence: Registry format enables search, attribution, and evolution tracking

problem_solution_pairs.problem: Researchers and developers lack a platform to test hypotheses before committing to full papers or projects
problem_solution_pairs.solution: Low-friction submission process (JSON template) with community validation replacing formal peer review for early-stage concepts
problem_solution_pairs.evidence: Faster feedback loop than academic publishing, more structured than social media

problem_solution_pairs.problem: Open-source ideas published on Twitter/blogs disappear into noise without proper attribution or follow-up
problem_solution_pairs.solution: Permanent, searchable registry with CC BY-SA 4.0 licensing ensuring proper attribution and GitHub Discussions for ongoing evolution
problem_solution_pairs.evidence: Git history + Discussions provide full provenance trail

use_cases.description: Test radical computing paradigm hypothesis before writing academic paper
use_cases.workflow: Submit as Hypothesis → Community feedback → Move to Experimentation → Publish findings
use_cases.impact: Validate concept viability in weeks vs months of paper writing

use_cases.description: Get community validation on which side project idea to pursue
use_cases.workflow: Submit 3 competing ideas → Track community engagement → Focus on highest-interest concept
use_cases.impact: Data-driven project selection based on real interest

use_cases.description: Crowdsource feature ideas and architectural improvements
use_cases.workflow: Submit project roadmap ideas → Community proposes alternatives → Vote via Discussion reactions
use_cases.impact: Democratic feature prioritization with clear attribution

use_cases.description: Document experimental explorations for institutional memory
use_cases.workflow: Submit failed experiments as Concepts → Tag with learnings → Future teams avoid duplicating dead ends
use_cases.impact: Preserve R&D knowledge that usually dies in private docs
